alert.note: Alert for Bollinger (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 5:22PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Missouri, including the following county, Bollinger. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 519 PM CDT, while doppler radar indicates the heaviest rain has come to an end, minor flooding is still possible from earlier heavy rain across the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Marble Hill, Leopold, Grassy and Glenallen. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
